pylapp.tapster.client.android.ui.taptargets

Interface HelpersDisplayerStub

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    TapTargetHelpersDisplayerSkeleton

    public HelpersDisplayerStub

    Stub based on design pattern Bridge which provides the declarations of methods to call so as to deal with an object which can display commandTap targets / pointers / elements as showcases/demo to introduce features or components of the GUI. This pattern is used so as to avoid an activity to have too many dependencies and code about the way tap targets are displayed. A library is used, so let's thing a step further in case of the death of this library.

    • Method Detail

      • buildPointer

        <T> T buildPointer(android.view.View view,
                   java.lang.String title,
                   java.lang.String description)

        Builds a commandTap target / pointer to a view, with title and descriptions

        Parameters:
        view -

        • The target on which the pointer must be displayed

        title -

        • The title or main text to display

        description -

        • A secondary text if needed

        Returns:
        T - The just-freshly-built pointer

      • startNewSequence

        <T> void startNewSequence(android.app.Activity context,
                          java.util.List<? extends T> targets)

        Builds a sequence of commandTap targets and start the display of this sequence

        Parameters:
        context -

        • The activity in use

        targets -

        • The element which have been built and will be displayed
